districts.name: Thiruvananthapuram
districts.description: The capital city known for its historic temples and vibrant culture.

attractions.name: Kovalam Beach
attractions.description: Famous for its pristine beaches and vibrant nightlife.

attractions.name: Napier Museum
attractions.description: A historical museum showcasing Kerala's rich cultural heritage.

attractions.name: Padmanabhaswamy Temple
attractions.description: An ancient temple known for its architectural beauty and religious significance.

fun_facts: Thiruvananthapuram is the capital city of Kerala.
It's home to the richest temple in the world, Padmanabhaswamy Temple.
The city has a rich colonial history.

districts.name: Kollam
districts.description: A coastal district famous for its cashew industry and scenic backwaters.

attractions.name: Ashtamudi Lake
attractions.description: The second-largest lake in Kerala, famous for its scenic beauty and boat rides.

attractions.name: Thangassery Beach
attractions.description: A serene beach known for its historic lighthouse and picturesque views.

attractions.name: Jatayu Earth's Center
attractions.description: A nature park and adventure center with the world's largest bird sculpture.

fun_facts: Kollam is one of the oldest ports on the Malabar Coast.
It's known as the 'Cashew Capital of the World'.
The city has a rich history of trade and commerce.

districts.name: Pathanamthitta
districts.description: A prominent pilgrimage center with lush green landscapes.

attractions.name: Sabarimala Temple
attractions.description: A famous pilgrimage site dedicated to Lord Ayyappa, attracting millions of devotees annually.

attractions.name: Perunthenaruvi Waterfalls
attractions.description: A stunning waterfall surrounded by lush greenery, perfect for picnics and nature walks.

attractions.name: Konni Elephant Training Center
attractions.description: An elephant training center where visitors can interact with and learn about these majestic animals.

fun_facts: Pathanamthitta is known as the 'Pilgrim Capital of Kerala' due to its numerous temples and religious sites.
It has the highest literacy rate in Kerala.
The district is home to several endangered species and wildlife sanctuaries.

districts.name: Alappuzha
districts.description: Known as the 'Venice of the East' for its vast network of backwaters and houseboats.

attractions.name: Alappuzha Backwaters
attractions.description: Famous for its network of canals, lakes, and houseboat cruises, offering a unique and tranquil experience.

attractions.name: Alappuzha Beach
attractions.description: A picturesque beach with a 150-year-old pier, ideal for relaxing and enjoying stunning sunsets.

attractions.name: Vembanad Lake
attractions.description: The largest lake in Kerala, known for its scenic beauty and vibrant ecosystem.

fun_facts: Alappuzha is often referred to as the 'Venice of the East' due to its extensive network of backwaters.
Nehru Trophy Boat Race, held annually in Alappuzha, is one of the most popular boat races in Kerala.
The district is famous for its coir industry and coir products.

districts.name: Kottayam
districts.description: A land of letters, latex, and lakes, renowned for its literacy rate and rubber plantations.

attractions.name: Kumarakom Bird Sanctuary
attractions.description: A paradise for birdwatchers, with over 180 species of birds, including migratory birds like Siberian cranes.

attractions.name: St. Mary's Forane Church, Kuravilangad
attractions.description: One of the oldest churches in Kerala, known for its architectural grandeur and religious significance.

attractions.name: Vaikom Mahadeva Temple
attractions.description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, famous for its architectural beauty and historical importance.

fun_facts: Kottayam is the first town in India to achieve 100% literacy.
It's known as the 'Land of Letters, Latex, and Lakes'.
The district is a major producer of rubber and spices.

districts.name: Idukki
districts.description: A mountainous district rich in wildlife sanctuaries and spice plantations.

attractions.name: Munnar
attractions.description: A breathtaking hill station known for its tea plantations, lush greenery, and panoramic views.

attractions.name: Thekkady
attractions.description: Home to Periyar National Park, offering wildlife safaris, boating, and trekking amidst dense forests.

attractions.name: Idukki Arch Dam
attractions.description: One of the highest arch dams in Asia, offering spectacular views of the surrounding mountains and reservoir.

fun_facts: Idukki is the second largest district in Kerala by area.
It's known for its abundant natural beauty and biodiversity.
The district has several hydroelectric power projects.

districts.name: Ernakulam
districts.description: The commercial hub of Kerala, home to the bustling city of Kochi.

attractions.name: Fort Kochi
attractions.description: A historic neighborhood with colonial buildings, ancient churches, and bustling markets.

attractions.name: Mattancherry Palace
attractions.description: Also known as the Dutch Palace, famous for its stunning murals depicting scenes from Hindu epics.

attractions.name: Cherai Beach
attractions.description: A beautiful beach with golden sands, ideal for swimming, sunbathing, and dolphin sightings.

fun_facts: Ernakulam is the commercial capital of Kerala.
It's home to the largest shopping mall in India, LuLu Mall.
The district is a major hub for spice trade and seafood.

districts.name: Thrissur
districts.description: Known as the 'Cultural Capital of Kerala' for its festivals and classical arts.

attractions.name: Vadakkunnathan Temple
attractions.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its unique architectural style and grandeur.

attractions.name: Athirappilly Waterfalls
attractions.description: The largest waterfall in Kerala, surrounded by lush green forests and scenic beauty.

attractions.name: Thrissur Pooram
attractions.description: A grand festival featuring decorated elephants, traditional music, and fireworks, held annually at Vadakkunnathan Temple.

fun_facts: Thrissur is known as the 'Cultural Capital of Kerala'.
It's famous for its temple festivals and vibrant cultural heritage.
The district is a major center for gold jewelry manufacturing.

districts.name: Palakkad
districts.description: The 'Granary of Kerala' with vast paddy fields and historical forts.

attractions.name: Silent Valley National Park
attractions.description: A pristine tropical rainforest, home to rare species of flora and fauna.

attractions.name: Palakkad Fort
attractions.description: An ancient fort built by Hyder Ali of Mysore, offering panoramic views of the surrounding area.

attractions.name: Malampuzha Dam and Gardens
attractions.description: A popular picnic spot with a dam, gardens, amusement park, and cable car rides.

fun_facts: Palakkad is known as the 'Granary of Kerala' due to its extensive paddy fields and rice cultivation.
It's one of the hottest places in Kerala during summer.
The district has a rich cultural heritage with influences from Tamil Nadu.

districts.name: Malappuram
districts.description: A district with a rich cultural heritage and vibrant Islamic traditions.

attractions.name: Kadalundi Bird Sanctuary
attractions.description: A haven for birdwatchers, with a wide variety of migratory birds and scenic landscapes.

attractions.name: Adyanpara Waterfalls
attractions.description: A stunning waterfall amidst lush greenery, perfect for nature lovers and trekking enthusiasts.

attractions.name: Kottakkunnu
attractions.description: A hill garden with a historical fort, offering panoramic views of Malappuram town and surroundings.

fun_facts: Malappuram is known for its rich cultural heritage and Islamic traditions.
It has the highest percentage of Muslim population in Kerala.
The district is famous for its traditional handicrafts and wood carving.

districts.name: Kozhikode
districts.description: A historic city known for its spice trade and delicious Malabar cuisine.

attractions.name: Kozhikode Beach
attractions.description: A popular beach with golden sands, perfect for sunset views and leisurely walks.

attractions.name: Kappad Beach
attractions.description: Historically significant as the place where Vasco da Gama landed in 1498, opening the sea route to India.

attractions.name: Beypore
attractions.description: Famous for its ancient shipbuilding industry and traditional Uru boats.

fun_facts: Kozhikode was the capital of the powerful Zamorin dynasty.
It's known as the 'City of Spices' due to its historic spice trade.
The district is famous for its Malabar cuisine and sweets.

districts.name: Wayanad
districts.description: A picturesque district with lush forests, wildlife sanctuaries, and ancient caves.

attractions.name: Edakkal Caves
attractions.description: Ancient rock shelters with inscriptions and petroglyphs dating back to the Stone Age.

attractions.name: Soochipara Waterfalls
attractions.description: A three-tiered waterfall surrounded by lush forests, ideal for trekking and adventure.

attractions.name: Banasura Sagar Dam
attractions.description: The largest earthen dam in India, offering boating, trekking, and panoramic views of the surrounding hills.

fun_facts: Wayanad is known for its pristine natural beauty and rich biodiversity.
It's the only district in Kerala that shares borders with both Karnataka and Tamil Nadu.
The district is a major producer of spices like pepper, cardamom, and coffee.

districts.name: Kannur
districts.description: A district rich in handloom industry, folklore, and scenic beaches.

attractions.name: Payyambalam Beach
attractions.description: A quiet and serene beach with golden sands and clear blue waters.

attractions.name: St. Angelo Fort
attractions.description: A historical fort overlooking the Arabian Sea, built by the Portuguese in the 16th century.

attractions.name: Muzhappilangad Beach
attractions.description: The only drive-in beach in Kerala, offering thrilling drives along the coast.

fun_facts: Kannur is known as the Land of Looms and Lores' due to its rich handloom industry and cultural heritage.
It's famous for its Theyyam rituals and folk art performances.
The district is known for its martial arts tradition and ancient temples.

districts.name: Kasaragod
districts.description: The northernmost district known for its diverse culture and historical forts.

attractions.name: Bekal Fort
attractions.description: A historic fort with stunning views of the Arabian Sea and scenic surroundings.

attractions.name: Kappil Beach
attractions.description: A serene beach with golden sands, perfect for relaxation and sunset views.

attractions.name: Chandragiri Fort
attractions.description: An ancient fort with a temple, mosque, and views of the Payaswini River and Arabian Sea.

fun_facts: Kasaragod is the northernmost district of Kerala.
It has a strong Tulu-speaking population and cultural influence.
The district is known for its unique Theyyam rituals and traditional folk arts.
